rules.natural: If author W submitted paper Z, then paper Z is retracted.
Provided that institution V investigated paper Z, if paper Z is not valid research, then paper Z is not plagiarized.
Under the condition that journal X assigned an editor to paper Z, editor T made a decision on paper Z.
Either journal X assigned an editor to paper Z or expert U was invited to review paper Z.
If expert U was invited to review paper Z, then institution V investigated paper Z.
Provided that editor T made a decision on paper Z, a revision was requested from author W for paper Z.
If a revision was requested from author W for paper Z, then author W submitted paper Z.
Whenever paper Z has minor issues, if paper Z is not valid research, then paper Z was corrected.
Under the condition that paper Z has major issues, provided that paper Z is not valid research, paper Z was corrected.
If journal X publishes research papers, then journal X has funding from a government grant.
Either journal X publishes research papers or journal X is peer-reviewed.
Assuming that author W made a formal appeal, author W filed an appeal.
Either author W made a formal appeal or author W made an informal complaint.
If author W is guilty, then author W is not cleared.
Provided that author W is blacklisted, author W is banned.
If journal X is peer-reviewed, then paper Y is accepted.
Assuming that journal X is peer-reviewed, journal X has a rigorous process.
Either a warning was issued to author W or author W is not banned.
If institution V took no action against author W, then a warning was not issued to author W.
Provided that paper Y is influential, paper Z is valid research.
Whenever journal X has high impact, if paper Y is cited, then paper Y is influential.
Either journal X is predatory or journal X has high impact.
If journal X is legitimate, then journal X is not predatory.
Provided that journal X is indexed properly, journal X is not predatory.
If journal X follows guidelines, then journal X is ethical.
Either journal X follows guidelines or journal X has a transparent process.
Under the condition that journal X has a transparent process, journal X is indexed properly.
Provided that paper Y is accepted, paper Y is cited.
Provided that journal X is ethical, journal X is accredited.
If journal X is recognized, then journal X is legitimate.
Under the condition that journal X is accredited, journal X is recognized.
Whenever journal X has a rigorous process, journal X uses blind review.
If journal X uses blind review, then journal X is unbiased.
Whenever journal X has fair evaluation, paper Z is valid research.
Provided that journal X is unbiased, journal X has fair evaluation.
If institution V opened an investigation on paper Z, then, if the absence of a decision by editor T implies submission by author W does not hold, editor T does not have a conflict of interest.
Either institution V conducted a full investigation of paper Z or, if institution V did not open an investigation on paper Z, then institution V conducted a preliminary review of paper Z.
Provided that evidence was found regarding paper Z, paper Z is not plagiarized.
Either a committee was formed by institution V for paper Z or an expert was consulted by institution V for paper Z.
Assuming that an expert was consulted by institution V for paper Z, if paper Z is not valid research, then evidence was found regarding paper Z.
Whenever author W self-reported regarding paper Z, paper Z is retracted.
Either author W self-reported regarding paper Z or a third party reported on paper Z.
Assuming that journal X started processing paper Z, journal X conducted initial screening on paper Z.
Provided that journal X conducted initial screening on paper Z, either author W submitted paper Z or institution V investigated paper Z.
Whenever journal X is reputable, if paper Y is cited, then paper Z is valid research.
Assuming that paper Z requires minor revisions, paper Z is conditionally accepted.
Either paper Z requires minor revisions or paper Z requires major revisions.
Provided that paper Z requires major revisions, if journal X completed the review of paper Z, then, whenever editor T made a decision on paper Z, author W submitted paper Z.
Either author W made corrections to paper Z or author W submitted revisions for paper Z.
Whenever author W submitted revisions for paper Z, if paper Z is not valid research, then paper Z was corrected.
If paper Z was resubmitted, then, if the absence of corrections by author W implies that non-valid research leads to correction does not hold, author W did not miss the deadline for paper Z.
Provided that paper Z is fast-tracked, paper Z was resubmitted.
Either paper Z is fast-tracked or paper Z undergoes the normal process.
Assuming that paper Z undergoes the normal process, paper Z was resubmitted.
Whenever paper Z has format issues, if the absence of desk rejection implies rejection does not hold, then paper Z was rejected for technical reasons.
Provided that paper Z violates length requirements, paper Z has style problems.
If paper Z has a scope mismatch, then, if paper Z does not have format issues, paper Z violates length requirements.
Assuming that paper Z needs translation, paper Z does not have language issues.
Provided that paper Z breaches guidelines, resubmission is allowed for paper Z.
Under the condition that journal X upheld the appeal for paper Z, journal X did not dismiss the appeal for paper Z.
If it is not the case that a decision by editor T implies submission by author W, then editor T has a conflict of interest.
Assuming that paper Z does not have minor issues or major issues, paper Z received a desk rejection.
Whenever paper Z does not have minor issues or major issues, paper Z has language issues.
Provided that paper Z does not have minor issues or major issues, paper Z needs translation.
If the absence of an informal complaint by author W implying that non-issues lead to rejection does not hold, then institution V applied sanctions to author W.
Provided that the absence of investigation completion implying that non-valid research and no ethical breach lead to misconduct does not hold, author W is cleared.
Assuming that the absence of investigation completion implying that non-valid research and no ethical breach lead to misconduct does not hold, author W is guilty.
If the absence of committee formation implying that non-valid research leads to evidence does not hold, then institution V closed the investigation on paper Z.
Provided that the absence of third-party report implying that non-valid research leads to no plagiarism does not hold, no finding was made by institution V regarding paper Z.
Assuming that the absence of corrections implying that non-valid research leads to correction does not hold, author W missed the deadline for paper Z.
If it is not the case that either journal X reviewed the appeal for paper Z or policy violation implies guideline breach, then journal X dismissed the appeal for paper Z.
Provided that the double negation of investigation completion implying that non-valid research and no ethical breach lead to misconduct not implying non-clearance holds, paper Z violates policy.

Assuming that the double negation of investigation completion implying that non-valid research and no ethical breach lead to misconduct not implying non-clearance holds, resubmission is not allowed for paper Z.
If journal X is not reputable, then author W is blacklisted.
Assuming that journal X is not reputable, journal X is indexed.
Whenever journal X is not reputable, journal X is not indexed.
Assuming that paper Z does not have a scope mismatch, paper Z has an unsuitable topic.
Provided that paper Z is not valid research, paper Z has an ethical breach.
Assuming that paper Z is not valid research, paper Z is plagiarized.

It is not the case that no finding was made by institution V regarding paper Z.
Paper Z is not conditionally accepted.
Paper Z was not rejected for technical reasons.
Paper Z does not have style problems.
Paper Z does not have an unsuitable topic.
Journal X did not review the appeal for paper Z.
Paper Z is not retracted.

(A1 ∨ G).natural: Either journal X has funding from a government grant or paper Z is valid research.

(A10 → A9).natural: If author W submitted paper Z, then paper Z is retracted.

(A10 ∨ A11).natural: Either author W submitted paper Z or institution V investigated paper Z.

(A11 → (¬G → ¬A8)).natural: Provided that institution V investigated paper Z, if paper Z is not valid research, then paper Z is not plagiarized.

(A12 → A10).natural: Whenever journal X assigned an editor to paper Z, author W submitted paper Z.

(A12 → A14).natural: Under the condition that journal X assigned an editor to paper Z, editor T made a decision on paper Z.

(A12 ∨ A13).natural: Either journal X assigned an editor to paper Z or expert U was invited to review paper Z.

(A13 → A11).natural: If expert U was invited to review paper Z, then institution V investigated paper Z.

(A14 → A10).natural: Assuming that editor T made a decision on paper Z, author W submitted paper Z.

(A14 → A15).natural: Provided that editor T made a decision on paper Z, a revision was requested from author W for paper Z.

(A15 → A10).natural: If a revision was requested from author W for paper Z, then author W submitted paper Z.

(A17 → (¬G → A16)).natural: Whenever paper Z has minor issues, if paper Z is not valid research, then paper Z was corrected.

(A17 ∨ A18).natural: Either paper Z has minor issues or paper Z has major issues.

(A18 → (¬G → A16)).natural: Under the condition that paper Z has major issues, provided that paper Z is not valid research, paper Z was corrected.

(A2 → A1).natural: If journal X publishes research papers, then journal X has funding from a government grant.

(A2 ∨ A3).natural: Either journal X publishes research papers or journal X is peer-reviewed.

(A20 ∨ (¬(A17 ∨ A18) → A19)).natural: Either author W filed an appeal or, if it is not the case that paper Z has minor issues or major issues, then paper Z is rejected.

(A21 → A20).natural: Assuming that author W made a formal appeal, author W filed an appeal.

(A21 ∨ A22).natural: Either author W made a formal appeal or author W made an informal complaint.

(A22 → (¬(A17 ∨ A18) → A19)).natural: Provided that author W made an informal complaint, if it is not the case that paper Z has minor issues or major issues, then paper Z is rejected.

(A26 → (¬(¬G → ¬A24) → A25)).natural: Whenever institution V completed the investigation of paper Z, if it is not the case that the absence of valid research implies no ethical breach, then misconduct was found in paper Z.

(A28 → ¬A27).natural: If author W is guilty, then author W is not cleared.

(A29 → A30).natural: Provided that author W is blacklisted, author W is banned.

(A3 → A4).natural: If journal X is peer-reviewed, then paper Y is accepted.

(A3 → A43).natural: Assuming that journal X is peer-reviewed, journal X has a rigorous process.

(A3 → G).natural: Under the condition that journal X is peer-reviewed, paper Z is valid research.

(A31 ∨ ¬A30).natural: Either a warning was issued to author W or author W is not banned.

(A32 → ¬A31).natural: If institution V took no action against author W, then a warning was not issued to author W.

(A33 → G).natural: Provided that paper Y is influential, paper Z is valid research.

(A34 → (A5 → A33)).natural: Whenever journal X has high impact, if paper Y is cited, then paper Y is influential.

(A35 ∨ A34).natural: Either journal X is predatory or journal X has high impact.

(A36 → ¬A35).natural: If journal X is legitimate, then journal X is not predatory.

(A36 ∨ A37).natural: Either journal X is legitimate or journal X is indexed properly.

(A37 → ¬A35).natural: Provided that journal X is indexed properly, journal X is not predatory.

(A38 → A36).natural: Assuming that journal X follows guidelines, journal X is legitimate.

(A38 → A40).natural: If journal X follows guidelines, then journal X is ethical.

(A38 ∨ A39).natural: Either journal X follows guidelines or journal X has a transparent process.

(A39 → A37).natural: Under the condition that journal X has a transparent process, journal X is indexed properly.

(A4 → A5).natural: Provided that paper Y is accepted, paper Y is cited.

(A4 → G).natural: Whenever paper Y is accepted, paper Z is valid research.

(A40 → A36).natural: If journal X is ethical, then journal X is legitimate.

(A40 → A41).natural: Assuming that journal X is ethical, journal X is recognized.

(A40 → A42).natural: Provided that journal X is ethical, journal X is accredited.

(A41 → A36).natural: If journal X is recognized, then journal X is legitimate.

(A42 → A41).natural: Under the condition that journal X is accredited, journal X is recognized.

(A43 → A44).natural: Whenever journal X has a rigorous process, journal X uses blind review.

(A43 → G).natural: Provided that journal X has a rigorous process, paper Z is valid research.

(A44 → A45).natural: Assuming that journal X uses blind review, journal X has fair evaluation.

(A44 → A46).natural: If journal X uses blind review, then journal X is unbiased.

(A44 → G).natural: Under the condition that journal X uses blind review, paper Z is valid research.

(A45 → G).natural: Whenever journal X has fair evaluation, paper Z is valid research.

(A46 → A45).natural: Provided that journal X is unbiased, journal X has fair evaluation.

(A48 → (¬(A14 → A10) → ¬A47)).natural: If institution V opened an investigation on paper Z, then, if the absence of a decision by editor T implies submission by author W does not hold, editor T does not have a conflict of interest.

(A5 → A33).natural: Assuming that paper Y is cited, paper Y is influential.

(A5 → G).natural: Whenever paper Y is cited, paper Z is valid research.

(A50 ∨ (¬A48 → A49)).natural: Either institution V conducted a full investigation of paper Z or, if institution V did not open an investigation on paper Z, then institution V conducted a preliminary review of paper Z.

(A51 → ¬A8).natural: Provided that evidence was found regarding paper Z, paper Z is not plagiarized.

(A52 → (¬G → A51)).natural: If a committee was formed by institution V for paper Z, then, if paper Z is not valid research, evidence was found regarding paper Z.

(A52 ∨ A53).natural: Either a committee was formed by institution V for paper Z or an expert was consulted by institution V for paper Z.

(A53 → (¬G → A51)).natural: Assuming that an expert was consulted by institution V for paper Z, if paper Z is not valid research, then evidence was found regarding paper Z.

(A55 → A9).natural: Whenever author W self-reported regarding paper Z, paper Z is retracted.

(A55 ∨ A56).natural: Either author W self-reported regarding paper Z or a third party reported on paper Z.

(A56 → (¬G → ¬A8)).natural: Provided that a third party reported on paper Z, if paper Z is not valid research, then paper Z is not plagiarized.

(A58 → (A10 ∨ A11)).natural: If journal X started processing paper Z, then either author W submitted paper Z or institution V investigated paper Z.

(A58 → A59).natural: Assuming that journal X started processing paper Z, journal X conducted initial screening on paper Z.

(A59 → (A10 ∨ A11)).natural: Provided that journal X conducted initial screening on paper Z, either author W submitted paper Z or institution V investigated paper Z.

(A6 → (A5 → G)).natural: Whenever journal X is reputable, if paper Y is cited, then paper Z is valid research.

(A60 → (A14 → A10)).natural: If journal X completed the review of paper Z, then, if editor T made a decision on paper Z, author W submitted paper Z.

(A61 ∨ (A60 → (A14 → A10))).natural: Either paper Z is conditionally accepted or, if journal X completed the review of paper Z, then, provided that editor T made a decision on paper Z, author W submitted paper Z.

(A62 → A61).natural: Assuming that paper Z requires minor revisions, paper Z is conditionally accepted.

(A62 ∨ A63).natural: Either paper Z requires minor revisions or paper Z requires major revisions.

(A63 → (A60 → (A14 → A10))).natural: Provided that paper Z requires major revisions, if journal X completed the review of paper Z, then, whenever editor T made a decision on paper Z, author W submitted paper Z.

(A64 → (¬G → A16)).natural: If author W made corrections to paper Z, then, provided that paper Z is not valid research, paper Z was corrected.

(A64 ∨ A65).natural: Either author W made corrections to paper Z or author W submitted revisions for paper Z.

(A65 → (¬G → A16)).natural: Whenever author W submitted revisions for paper Z, if paper Z is not valid research, then paper Z was corrected.

(A67 → (¬(A64 → (¬G → A16)) → ¬A66)).natural: If paper Z was resubmitted, then, if the absence of corrections by author W implies that non-valid research leads to correction does not hold, author W did not miss the deadline for paper Z.

(A68 → A67).natural: Provided that paper Z is fast-tracked, paper Z was resubmitted.

(A68 ∨ A69).natural: Either paper Z is fast-tracked or paper Z undergoes the normal process.

(A69 → A67).natural: Assuming that paper Z undergoes the normal process, paper Z was resubmitted.

(A70 → A19).natural: If paper Z received a desk rejection, then paper Z is rejected.

(A72 → (¬(A70 → A19) → A71)).natural: Whenever paper Z has format issues, if the absence of desk rejection implies rejection does not hold, then paper Z was rejected for technical reasons.

(A74 → A73).natural: Provided that paper Z violates length requirements, paper Z has style problems.

(A75 → (¬A72 → A74)).natural: If paper Z has a scope mismatch, then, if paper Z does not have format issues, paper Z violates length requirements.

(A78 → ¬A77).natural: Assuming that paper Z needs translation, paper Z does not have language issues.

(A80 → A79).natural: Whenever paper Z violates policy, resubmission is allowed for paper Z.

(A80 → A81).natural: If paper Z violates policy, then paper Z breaches guidelines.

(A81 → A79).natural: Provided that paper Z breaches guidelines, resubmission is allowed for paper Z.

(A82 ∨ (A80 → A81)).natural: Either journal X reviewed the appeal for paper Z or, if paper Z violates policy, then paper Z breaches guidelines.

(A84 → ¬A83).natural: Under the condition that journal X upheld the appeal for paper Z, journal X did not dismiss the appeal for paper Z.

(A9 ∨ (¬G → ¬A8)).natural: Either paper Z is retracted or, if paper Z is not valid research, then paper Z is not plagiarized.

(¬(A14 → A10) → A47).natural: If it is not the case that a decision by editor T implies submission by author W, then editor T has a conflict of interest.

(¬(A14 → A10) → ¬A47).natural: Provided that the absence of a decision by editor T implying submission by author W holds, editor T does not have a conflict of interest.

(¬(A17 ∨ A18) → A19).natural: If it is not the case that paper Z has minor issues or major issues, then paper Z is rejected.

(¬(A17 ∨ A18) → A70).natural: Assuming that paper Z does not have minor issues or major issues, paper Z received a desk rejection.

(¬(A17 ∨ A18) → A77).natural: Whenever paper Z does not have minor issues or major issues, paper Z has language issues.

(¬(A17 ∨ A18) → A78).natural: Provided that paper Z does not have minor issues or major issues, paper Z needs translation.

(¬(A17 ∨ A18) → ¬A77).natural: If paper Z does not have minor issues or major issues, then paper Z does not have language issues.

(¬(A22 → (¬(A17 ∨ A18) → A19)) → A23).natural: If the absence of an informal complaint by author W implying that non-issues lead to rejection does not hold, then institution V applied sanctions to author W.

(¬(A26 → (¬(¬G → ¬A24) → A25)) → A27).natural: Provided that the absence of investigation completion implying that non-valid research and no ethical breach lead to misconduct does not hold, author W is cleared.

(¬(A26 → (¬(¬G → ¬A24) → A25)) → A28).natural: Assuming that the absence of investigation completion implying that non-valid research and no ethical breach lead to misconduct does not hold, author W is guilty.

(¬(A26 → (¬(¬G → ¬A24) → A25)) → ¬A27).natural: Whenever the absence of investigation completion implying that non-valid research and no ethical breach lead to misconduct does not hold, author W is not cleared.

(¬(A52 → (¬G → A51)) → A54).natural: If the absence of committee formation implying that non-valid research leads to evidence does not hold, then institution V closed the investigation on paper Z.

(¬(A56 → (¬G → ¬A8)) → A57).natural: Provided that the absence of third-party report implying that non-valid research leads to no plagiarism does not hold, no finding was made by institution V regarding paper Z.

(¬(A64 → (¬G → A16)) → A66).natural: Assuming that the absence of corrections implying that non-valid research leads to correction does not hold, author W missed the deadline for paper Z.

(¬(A64 → (¬G → A16)) → ¬A66).natural: If the absence of corrections implying that non-valid research leads to correction does not hold, then author W did not miss the deadline for paper Z.

(¬(A70 → A19) → A71).natural: Provided that the absence of desk rejection implying rejection does not hold, paper Z was rejected for technical reasons.

(¬(A82 ∨ (A80 → A81)) → A83).natural: If it is not the case that either journal X reviewed the appeal for paper Z or policy violation implies guideline breach, then journal X dismissed the appeal for paper Z.

(¬(¬(A26 → (¬(¬G → ¬A24) → A25)) → ¬A27).natural: Whenever the double negation of investigation completion implying that non-valid research and no ethical breach lead to misconduct not implying non-clearance holds, resubmission is allowed for paper Z.
Provided that the double negation of investigation completion implying that non-valid research and no ethical breach lead to misconduct not implying non-clearance holds, paper Z violates policy.

Assuming that the double negation of investigation completion implying that non-valid research and no ethical breach lead to misconduct not implying non-clearance holds, resubmission is not allowed for paper Z.

(¬(¬G → ¬A24) → A25).natural: If it is not the case that the absence of valid research implies no ethical breach, then misconduct was found in paper Z.

(¬A48 → A49).natural: Provided that institution V did not open an investigation on paper Z, institution V conducted a preliminary review of paper Z.

(¬A6 → A29).natural: If journal X is not reputable, then author W is blacklisted.

(¬A6 → A7).natural: Assuming that journal X is not reputable, journal X is indexed.

(¬A6 → ¬A7).natural: Whenever journal X is not reputable, journal X is not indexed.

(¬A72 → A73).natural: Provided that paper Z does not have format issues, paper Z has style problems.

(¬A72 → A74).natural: If paper Z does not have format issues, then paper Z violates length requirements.

(¬A75 → A76).natural: Assuming that paper Z does not have a scope mismatch, paper Z has an unsuitable topic.

(¬G → A16).natural: Whenever paper Z is not valid research, paper Z was corrected.

(¬G → A24).natural: Provided that paper Z is not valid research, paper Z has an ethical breach.

(¬G → A51).natural: If paper Z is not valid research, then evidence was found regarding paper Z.

(¬G → A8).natural: Assuming that paper Z is not valid research, paper Z is plagiarized.

(¬G → ¬A24).natural: Whenever paper Z is not valid research, paper Z does not have an ethical breach.

(¬G → ¬A8).natural: Provided that paper Z is not valid research, paper Z is not plagiarized.

A26.natural: Institution V completed the investigation of paper Z.

A32.natural: Institution V took no action against author W.

A48.natural: Institution V opened an investigation on paper Z.

A58.natural: Journal X started processing paper Z.

A60.natural: Journal X completed the review of paper Z.

A75.natural: Paper Z has a scope mismatch.

A84.natural: Journal X upheld the appeal for paper Z.

¬A1.natural: Journal X does not have funding from a government grant.

¬A20.natural: Author W did not file an appeal.

¬A23.natural: Institution V did not apply sanctions to author W.

¬A25.natural: Misconduct was not found in paper Z.

¬A31.natural: A warning was not issued to author W.

¬A49.natural: Institution V did not conduct a preliminary review of paper Z.

¬A50.natural: Institution V did not conduct a full investigation of paper Z.

¬A54.natural: Institution V did not close the investigation on paper Z.

¬A57.natural: It is not the case that no finding was made by institution V regarding paper Z.

¬A61.natural: Paper Z is not conditionally accepted.

¬A71.natural: Paper Z was not rejected for technical reasons.

¬A73.natural: Paper Z does not have style problems.

¬A76.natural: Paper Z does not have an unsuitable topic.

¬A82.natural: Journal X did not review the appeal for paper Z.

¬A83.natural: Journal X did not dismiss the appeal for paper Z.
